intro: Cyrtandra terna, commonly known as the three-leaved cyrtandra, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Asia and the Pacific. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family, which includes many ornamental and medicinal plants. The plant is characterized by its opposite, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink. Cyrtandra terna typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream sides. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest for both horticultural and ecological studies.
